snippet: When a college education is critical in today’s economy, a national discussion on how to make public institutions more affordable is long overdue.
abstract: Editorial supports Pres Obama's proposal to shift federal aid away from colleges that fail to control rising tuition; asserts that the federal government must do more to rein in tuition costs at the public colleges that educate more than 70 percent of the nation's students; holds that with a college education being critical in today's economy, a national discussion on how to make public education more affordable is long overdue.
lead_paragraph: When a college education is critical in today’s economy, a national discussion on how to make public institutions more affordable is long overdue.
